doc:
Glenda Farrell https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glenda_Farrell 0 Glenda Farrell (June 30, 1904 – May 1, 1971) was an American actress of film, television, and theater. She is best known for her role as Torchy Blane in the Warner Bros. Torchy Blane film series and the Academy Award-nominated films Little Caesar (1931), I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang (1932), and Lady for a Day (1933). With a career spanning more than 50 years, Farrell appeared in over 100 films and television series, as well as numerous Broadway plays. She received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on February 8, 1960, and won an Emmy Award for best supporting actress for her performance in the television series Ben Casey in 1963. Glenda_Farrell ( June_30_,_1904 – May_1_,_1971 ) was an_American_actress of film_,_television , and theater . She is_best_known for her_role as Torchy_Blane in the_Warner_Bros . Torchy_Blane_film_series and the_Academy_Award-nominated_films Little_Caesar_(_1931_) , I Am a_Fugitive from a_Chain_Gang_(_1932_) , and Lady for a_Day_(_1933_) . With a_career spanning more_than_50_years , Farrell appeared in over_100_films_and_television_series , as_well_as numerous_Broadway_plays . She received a_star on the_Hollywood_Walk of Fame on February_8_,_1960 , and won an_Emmy_Award for_best_supporting_actress for her_performance in the_television_series_Ben_Casey in 1963 .
